comments.content:
Thank you, could very well be. Comes from an old document I scanned  
Willi W.

Calligraphy.

The capital has some of the flavor of 15th century Textura, such as Altdeutsch [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/alt-deutsch/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090025/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/alt-deutsch/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/alt-deutsch/") Psalterium [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/alterlittera/psalterium/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090025/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/alterlittera/psalterium/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/alterlittera/psalterium/") and Octoberfest [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/aerotype/octoberfest/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090025/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/aerotype/octoberfest/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/aerotype/octoberfest/")

The lower case has some similarity to several rationalist frakturs: Luthersche Fraktur [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/luthersche-fraktur/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090025/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/luthersche-fraktur/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/luthersche-fraktur/") Walbaum Fraktur [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/walbaum-fraktur/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090025/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/walbaum-fraktur/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/walbaum-fraktur/") and Breitkopf Fraktur [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/breitkopf-fraktur/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420090025/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/breitkopf-fraktur/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/breitkopf-fraktur/")

Don
